messages.message: Hey Brian! We have an awesome opportunity open right now for a DH client in Scottsdale. They are looking for an AngularJS Front End Web Developer to add to their team. Are you open to getting more details?!
What company?
ICE
International Cruises & Excursions
They don't hire people like me.
LOL! What do you mean people like you? :)
Disruptive.
Oh. OK. I see -- if you happen to know anyone who has Angular experience I certainly appreciate any help. We have a $1000 referral bonus for this role.
I started to like angular a lot.
What do they want? Maybe I can do two jobs at a time like Evan Spiegel?

Haha! Here is what they are looking for:
We are looking for an AngularJS Front-End Web Developer to join our client’s innovative and dynamic technology environment. The successful candidate will develop, test and implement software while working with the Business Development/Product Management teams. 
Responsibilities:
•	Support all phases of software development from creation to implementation and support. 
•	Create and maintain web applications and services that interact with platform data management repositories.
•	Develop sophisticated UI utilizing partial design concepts integrated to core API platform.
•	Create reusable modules and components which extend the elements of core AngularJS
•	Work with designers, software engineers and architects for platform design and development.
•	Design and build scalable framework to backend services that scale to meet concurrency and performance requirements using C#, ASP.NET MVC, Web API. 
•	Deliver seamless responsive customer experiences based on various browser/device utilization
•	Work with QA team to ensure the solution delivers highest quality and highly available products.
•	Architect and automate the build process for production, using TFS and other toolsets as defined
Required:
•	Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field
•	Minimum of 5+ years of software development experience with 2+ years AngularJS experience, and a deep knowledge of best practices
•	Must be skilled building RESTful APIs
•	Must be able to build UI Web Components
•	Must have excellent communication skills, and able to communicate clearly in English, both verbally and written.
•	Must have excellent work ethic and attitude
•	Must be able to work with little direction, and be able to complete projects under strict deadlines
AngularJS or angular 2? AngularJS and Angular2 are out of date. We're on angular 4 now.
AngularJS
Bummer. That's so outdated. Are you sure that is what they want?
Yes, and they're moving to Angular2 soon
Wow that's like the perfect scapegoat.
What do you mean?
Hard to get excited about "moving to that soon".
Well its not Angular4 that's for sure! Sounds/looks like Swiftpage is using some cutting edge technologies.
It's the only way to make things exciting. Software development is pretty awful.
No way! It's exciting! I wish I could be a developer! LOL
Really? You like running in to crippling bugs outside your control?
Sounds exciting
